ratings.comment: Shawnika was an amazing professor. 345 is probably my favorite class I've taken in college. She's extremely intelligent, enthusiastic and inspiring. This is a hard class and requires a lot of work, but Shawnika is always available to answer questions and give feedback. She's incredible and has really toned arms.

Shawnika has been by far one of the best professors I've had.  J345 itself asks a lot of you, but Shawnika pushed our group and we got amazing results from her feedback.  She grades hard and expects a lot but gives farily easy exams to keep your grade from dropping too low.  Lecture usually flies by and you can tell she loves what she does.

Prof. Hull is super smart and extremely eloquent. She's a great lecturer. The first half of the course blows material-wise (it's confusing and poorly clarified), but gets way more interesting after the first midterm. Great class for those thinking about getting into research.
Well organized and very clear. But TAs do all the grading and in my experience the grading was harsh.
I loved her! She is engaging and has interesting lectures with interesting material.  She did a great job.  It's a difficult class but if you read and attend lecture/discussion, it's not that bad.

Shawnika is great! She keeps class interesting and it is easy to see she really cares about what she's teaching. She's young, so she talks more like a college student than a prof. Exams are all written, but she's very clear what she expects of you. The class is a lot of work, but well worth it!
Must have improved with experience.  A very good and interesting lecturer and definitely keeps me engaged.

I loved her! She really knows her information really well and has a lot of charisma when she speaks! She's really fair and clearly tells you what she expects from you. Just don't get caught sleeping in class- she will stop lecture and wake you up.

She is one of the best professors I've ever had. She's really passionate about what she's teaching. Her class was so engaging that as a junior, it was my first semester of regularly attending a lecture. She's intimidating for sure, but if you talk to her after class, she'll love you. Very intelligent critical thinker

Fairly engaging lecturer, uses many videos and examples, but doesn't seem incredibly knowledgeable about the content. WAY too many guest lectures. Exams are very easy if you attend and read, 3 short papers require some work. Learned much more about writing in section and from TA than professor.

Hull is funny and relates the lecture to our generation, but seems very biased. When she actually lectures, they're interesting, however, it seemed like she almost had as many guest lectures as lectures of her own. Only a couple were interesting. Definitely go over the articles in the reader. TA graded, but not difficult to get a good grade.
Not prepared for class lectures,  she simply reads off of the slides and is not engaging. Knowledegable about the topics but does not answer questions. No cell phone or laptop use.

Sad to think the advertising campaigns class is taught by a person who has zero ad agency experience.  I can't believe this is who they have teach a class so important to ad majors. She's difficult, disorganized, and frankly was a huge disappointment.

The material for this class is really interesting, unfortunately the professor is an extremely hard and inconsistent lecturer and grader. She's unclear about what she expects and doesn't give good or helpful feedback regarding papers and exams. There's also a double standard for what the professor expects and how the professor performs in class.

When she actually lectures, she is interesting. However, the other class slots are filled up with guest speakers and documentaries. Exams are based more off of the reading and off her lectures. Discussion section is where you actually learn. Overall this class is not what I expected it to be.

A really biased professor - doesn't allow room for the other side. She is really critical and skeptical of media in a far too extreme way. She reads lectures off a script so its not in an easy way to learn and she goes too fast. Exams are impossible in the time limit she gives and are really hard to study for. She never knows questions when asked.

She is just terrible. Reads lecture from a script, gets flustered whenever questions are asked, uses content that is grossly outdated, says y'all non-stop--even though she's not from the south, is openly biased politically, her actual lecture content is either simply wrong, debatable, outdated, or childish, and the class is graded far too harshly.

Professor Hull is awesome! She really knows what she is talking about and she's always cracking jokes and being sarcastic! Exams are short answer and an essay. Somewhat difficult, but manageable. The class consists of a lot of reading and some speaking, but it's well worth your time to take it!

talks way too fast, doesnt allow computers in class so its hard to write everything down. doesnt give any outline of what is going to be on the exams. exam format- 5 short answer definition paragraphs and 1 essay (5 paragraphs with thesis) all to be completed in 50 minutes. time constraint is a huge issue
